channel.title: Floor Objects
channel.description:
i'm coding a cammy pvp source
And I need to remove ALL ground floor objects, Is this possible? [IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/fefnza.png[/img]
Please help!

item.title: Floor Objects
item.dc:creator: @P_A_N_I_C P A N I C
item.description:
@P_A_N_I_C wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=P A N I C link=topic=485541.msg3557859#msg3557859 date=1302034927]

[size=20pt]Try putting this in your initialize method, in the client class (.java).[/size]

for (int i = 0; i < 6000; i++) { /* method to delete objects, with the argument 'i' for both x and y */ }Not sure of Delta’s method, so I’ll let you get it. (Unless Usman remembers it, or someone else knows it.)

Delta doesn’t come with a deleteobject method. He probably uses the one which is in tutorials.

for (int i = 0; i < 6000; i++) { deletethatobject(i, i); }

this goes in client.java?
im confused,
[/quote]Did you read it?[/quote]
Got it
Tysm
rep++ (if i could)

Read full topic

item.title: Floor Objects
item.dc:creator: @P_A_N_I_C P A N I C
item.description:
@P_A_N_I_C wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:8, topic:389631”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=485541.msg3557829#msg3557829 date=1302033576]
Try putting this in your initialize method, in the client class (.java).

for (int i = 0; i < 6000; i++) { /* method to delete objects, with the argument 'i' for both x and y */ }Not sure of Delta’s method, so I’ll let you get it. (Unless Usman remembers it, or someone else knows it.)
[/quote]

Delta doesn’t come with a deleteobject method. He probably uses the one which is in tutorials.

for (int i = 0; i < 6000; i++) { deletethatobject(i, i); }[/quote]
this goes in client.java?
im confused,

Read full topic

item.title: Floor Objects
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Try putting this in your initialize method, in the client class (.java).

for (int i = 0; i < 6000; i++) { /* method to delete objects, with the argument 'i' for both x and y */ }Not sure of Delta’s method, so I’ll let you get it. (Unless Usman remembers it, or someone else knows it.)[/quote]

Delta doesn’t come with a deleteobject method. He probably uses the one which is in tutorials.

for (int i = 0; i < 6000; i++) { deletethatobject(i, i); }

Read full topic

item.description:

I Vain I:

Wait, you want to delete all the objects, everywhere? (No bank booths, no trees, nothing at all in the whole work but buildings?)

Yes i want everything removed from source buildings and all

item.title: Floor Objects
item.dc:creator: @P_A_N_I_C P A N I C
item.description:
@P_A_N_I_C wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:3, topic:389631”]It could be possible to loop the whole server using the deleteObject method, but I’m not familiar with loops.
It’s easy to delete some objects, but without looping and doing every object one by one, it will take years.[/quote]
I tried that it takes to long

Read full topic

item.title: Floor Objects
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

It could be possible to loop the whole server using the deleteObject method, but I’m not familiar with loops.
It’s easy to delete some objects, but without looping and doing every object one by one, it will take years.

item.title: Floor Objects
item.dc:creator: @P_A_N_I_C P A N I C
item.description:
@P_A_N_I_C wrote:

I Vain I:

Yes it’s possible. You can use a map editor to remove them easily, or you can use the hard-coded method in the server to remove them.

How do I do that :L

Read full topic
